pageContext.claim: “President Obama gave me a beautiful birthday present when he gave me 138 judges that weren't approved. And, frankly, how do you consider that being a great President when you hand to the opposition 138 slots of federal judges, including appellate court judges and one Supreme Court judge?”
pageContext.analysis: There were 88 district and 17 court of appeals vacancies when Trump took office, so a total of 105 -- not through Obama's lack of effort. Senate Republicans refused to move on his nominations.
